titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

body.p: A fine still morning threatening fog. Knox celebrated at 8 a.m.; 26 comts. I celebrated after Mattins: 92 comts. There was a fairly large congregation at 11 a.m. Alf. Lyttelton & Lord St Aldwyn were present. I preached an old sermon written six years ago for All Saints: "The souls of the righteous are in the Hands of God." In the Vestry Craik told me that Lord Selby's death is announced in the Sunday papers.
The Archdeacon & Mr Gully called on me to arrange for the Memorial Service next Wednesday.

p.hi: came to tea. He brought Prof. Briggs's book on "Church Unity" for me to see.

body.p: These was a fair, but not crowded, congregation at Evensong. I preached from Rev. XIX. After service, the 'Dead March' was played in regards for the late speaker.
